reader.plugins
Interface TabularDataReader

All Known Implementing Classes:
ExcelReader
public interface TabularDataReader

The interface for data reader plugins in the triplifier system. This interface considers a data source to be a set of tables, each of which contains 0 or more rows of data. The methods hasNextTable() and moveToNextTable() are used to examine each table in the data source, and the methods tableHasNextRow() and tableGetNextRow() are used to iterate through all rows in the active table.

getFormatDescription

java.lang.String getFormatDescription()
Get a human-friendly description of the file format(s) supported by this reader. This should be a longer, more informative description than the value returned by getFormatString().

Returns:
A human-readable description of the file format(s) supported by this reader.

getFormatString

java.lang.String getFormatString()
Get a short string identifying the file format(s) supported by this reader. This string can be treated as a constant that is used to request this reader from a ReaderManager, via ReaderManager's getReader() method.

Returns:
A short string that identifies the file format(s) supported by this reader.

java.lang.String getShortFormatDesc()
Get a short, human-friendly description of the file format(s) supported by this reader. The value returned by this method should be appropriate for use in dialogs, such as file choosers.

Returns:
A short, human-readable description of the file format(s) supported by this reader.

hasNextTable

boolean hasNextTable()
Test if there is at least one table waiting to be processed in the data source. This should always return true immediately after a new data source is opened (i.e., before any data has been read).

Returns:
True if the data source has at least one more table waiting to be processed; false otherwise.

moveToNextTable

void moveToNextTable()
Set the active table to the next table in the data source. After opening a data source, this method must be called in order to read the first table from the data source, even if it contains only one table (e.g., CSV files).

openFile

boolean openFile(java.lang.String filepath)
Open the specified file for reading. Returns true if the file was opened successfully.

Parameters:
filepath - A file from which to read data.
Returns:
True if the file was opened and is ready to read data from; false otherwise.

setTable

void setTable(java.lang.String table)
              throws java.lang.Exception
Throws:
java.lang.Exception

tableGetNextRow

java.lang.String[] tableGetNextRow()
                                   throws java.sql.SQLException
Get the next row of data from the active table of the data source. The row is returned as an array of Strings, where each element of the array represents one column in the source data.

Returns:
The next row of data from the data source.
Throws:
java.sql.SQLException

tableHasNextRow

boolean tableHasNextRow()
Test if there is at least one more row of data waiting to be read from the active table of the opened data source.

Returns:
True if the data source has at least one more row of data to read; false otherwise.

testFile

boolean testFile(java.lang.String filepath)
Test the specified file to see if it is in a format supported by this TabularDataReader. If so, return true, otherwise, return false.

Parameters:
filepath - The path to a source data file.
Returns:
True if the file format is supported by this reader, false otherwise.
